name: Jollof Rice
cooking_method: Rinse the rice several times in cold water until the water runs clear. Drain and set aside.In a large, heavy-bottomed pot, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and bell pepper and sauté until softened, about 5 minutes.Add the garlic and sauté for another minute or until fragrant.Add the chopped tomatoes, tomato paste, smoked paprika, thyme, curry powder, ground ginger, salt, and cayenne pepper, and stir well to combine. Cook for 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the tomatoes have broken down and the mixture has thickened.Add the rice to the pot and stir well to coat with the tomato mixture.Add the water and broth to the pot and stir well to combine. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and cover the pot with a tight-fitting lid.Simmer the rice for 18-20 minutes or until the liquid has been absorbed and the rice is tender. If using frozen mixed vegetables, add them to the pot in the last 5 minutes of cooking.Remove the pot from the heat and let it sit, covered, for 5-10 minutes to allow the rice to steam and absorb any remaining liquid.Fluff the rice with a fork and garnish with fresh cilantro or parsley. Serve hot and enjoy!

name: Piri Piri Chicken
cooking_method: In a large bowl, whisk together the Piri Piri sauce, olive oil, lemon juice, minced garlic, paprika, and salt.Add the chicken pieces to the bowl and toss to coat evenly with the marinade.Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 2 hours, or overnight for best results.Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C). Line a baking sheet with foil and place a wire rack on top.Remove the chicken from the marinade and place it on the wire rack, leaving some space between each piece.Bake the chicken in the oven for 40-45 minutes or until the internal temperature reaches 165°F (75°C) on an instant-read thermometer.Remove the chicken from the oven and let it rest for 5-10 minutes before serving.Garnish with chopped parsley or cilantro if desired, and serve hot.Enjoy your delicious Piri Piri Chicken!

name: Injera
cooking_method: In a large bowl, mix together the teff flour, water, and active dry yeast (if using) until smooth. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap or a kitchen towel and let it sit at room temperature for 12-24 hours, or until the batter has become bubbly and slightly sour.Stir in the salt, then let the batter rest for another 30 minutes to 1 hour.Heat a nonstick skillet or griddle over medium-high heat. Lightly coat the surface with vegetable oil or cooking spray. Pour 1/4-1/2 cup of the batter onto the hot skillet and quickly swirl the pan to spread the batter into a thin, even layer.Cook the Injera for 1-2 minutes or until the edges begin to curl up and the surface is dry and bubbly.Use a spatula to carefully loosen the Injera from the pan, then transfer it to a plate or cooling rack. Repeat with the remaining batter, lightly coating the skillet with oil or cooking spray as needed.Stack the cooked Injera on top of each other to keep them warm and moist. Serve the Injera as a base for stews, curries, or other Ethiopian dishes.

name: Bunny Chow
cooking_method: Heat the vegetable oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the onion and sauté until softened and translucent, about 5 minutes.Add the garlic and ginger and sauté for an additional 2 minutes.Add the tomatoes, curry powder, cumin,coriander to the pot and stir well to combine.Add the chicken to the pot and season with salt and pepper to taste. Cook until the chicken is browned on all sides.Pour in the water and bring the mixture to a boil.Reduce the heat to low, cover the pot, and let simmer for about 30 minutes, or until the chicken is fully cooked and tender.Hollow out the centers of the bread loaves, leaving a shell with about a 1/2-inch thickness.Spoon the chicken mixture into the bread loaves and garnish with chopped cilantro.Serve hot and enjoy!

name: Lemon Drizzle Cake
cooking_method: Preheat the oven to 180°C/160°C fan/gas mark 4.Grease a loaf tin and line with baking parchment.In a large mixing bowl, beat the butter and caster sugar together until light and fluffy.Add the eggs, one at a time, mixing well after each addition.Fold in the flour and lemon zest.Spoon the mixture into the prepared tin and smooth the surface.Bake for 45-50 minutes, or until a skewer inserted into the centre of the cake comes out clean.Meanwhile, mix the lemon juice and granulated sugar together in a small bowl.When the cake is cooked, remove it from the oven and leave to cool in the tin for 5 minutes.Using a skewer or fork, prick holes all over the top of the cake and spoon the lemon and sugar mixture over the top, ensuring it is evenly distributed.Leave the cake to cool completely in the tin before removing and slicing to serve.

name: Spaghetti Carbonara
cooking_method: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add the spaghetti and cook for 8-10 minutes, or until al dente.While the spaghetti is cooking, cook the pancetta in a large skillet over medium heat until crispy. Remove the pancetta with a slotted spoon and set aside.In a bowl, whisk together the eggs, Pecorino Romano cheese, and black pepper.When the spaghetti is cooked, reserve 1 cup of the pasta water and drain the rest. Add the spaghetti to the skillet with the pancetta and toss to combine.Remove the skillet from the heat and let it cool for 1-2 minutes. Then, add the egg mixture to the skillet and toss quickly to avoid scrambling the eggs. Add some of the reserved pasta water to create a creamy sauce.Serve immediately, topped with additional Pecorino Romano cheese and black pepper.

name: Suya
cooking_method: Soak the skewers in water for at least 30 minutes before using to prevent them from burning on the grill.In a large bowl, mix together the groundnut oil, paprika, cayenne pepper, onion powder, garlic powder, ginger powder, dried thyme, salt, and pepper.Add the beef strips to the bowl and toss to coat the meat in the spice mixture. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight.Preheat your grill to medium-high heat.Thread the beef strips onto the skewers, leaving a small space between each piece.Place the skewers on the grill and cook for about 8-10 minutes, flipping once halfway through, until the meat is cooked to your desired level of doneness.Serve hot with sliced onions, tomato, and cucumber on the side, or wrapped in a piece of flatbread or tortilla, if desired.

name: Chakalaka
cooking_method: Heat the vegetable oil in a large pan over medium-high heat.Add the chopped onion and sauté until softened and translucent, about 5 minutes. Add the minced garlic and sauté for an additional minute.Add the chopped green and red bell peppers, grated carrots, curry powder, ground cumin, ground coriander, and paprika to the pan. Stir well to combine.Cook the vegetables for 5-7 minutes, until they start to soften.Add the can of diced tomatoes and their juice to the pan, and stir well.Add the can of baked beans in tomato sauce to the pan, and stir well to combine.Reduce the heat to low, cover the pan, and let simmer for about 20-25 minutes, stirring occasionally, untilvegetables are fully cooked and the mixture has thickened.Season with salt and pepper to taste.Serve hot as a side dish with grilled meat, pap, or bread.

name: Shepherd's Pie
cooking_method: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).Brown the ground beef and onion in a large skillet over medium-high heat until beef is no longer pink. Drain excess fat.Add the mixed vegetables, diced tomatoes, beef broth, tomato paste, garlic, thyme, salt, and pepper to the skillet. Stir to combine and bring to a boil.Reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes.Spread the beef mixture evenly into a 9x13 inch baking dish.Top with the mashed potatoes and spread them evenly over the beef mixture.Sprinkle the shredded cheddar cheese over the top of the mashed potatoes.Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and the pie is heated through.Let the pie cool for a few minutes before serving.

name: Fufu
cooking_method: Put the cassava chunks in a large pot and cover with water.Bring the water to a boil over high heat and cook the cassava for 20-30 minutes, or until it's very soft and tender.Drain the cassava, reserving some of the cooking water.Transfer the cassava to a large mortar or a sturdy bowl.Use a pestle or a large spoon to pound the cassava into a smooth, dough-like consistency.Gradually add some of the reserved cooking water to the cassava while pounding, until you reach the desired consistency.Add salt to taste and continue pounding until the fufu is smooth and elastic.Serve hot with a soup or stew of your choice.

name: Pounded Yam
cooking_method: Peel and chop the yam into small pieces.Rinse the yam pieces in cold water to remove any dirt or debris.Put the yam pieces in a large pot and cover with water.Bring the water to a boil over high heat and cook the yam for 20-30 minutes, or until it's very soft and tender.Drain the yam, reserving some of the cooking water.Transfer the yam to a large mortar or a sturdy bowl.Use a pestle or a large spoon to pound the yam until it becomes smooth and elastic. Add small amounts of the reserved cooking water as needed to help with the pounding process.Once the yam is pounded, transfer it to a clean pot and heat over low heat. Stir constantly for 5-10 minutes to remove any excess moisture and to further smooth out the mixture.Add salt to taste and continue stirring until the Pounded Yam is heated through and ready to serve.

name: Biltong
cooking_method: In a large bowl, mix together the vinegar, salt, sugar, and spices to create a marinade.Add the beef strips to the marinade and toss to coat.Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and marinate the beef in the fridge for at least 4 hours, or overnight.Preheat the oven to 160°F (70°C) or the lowest possible setting.Remove the beef strips from the marinade and pat them dry with paper towels.Thread the beef strips onto wooden skewers or hang them on a drying rack.Place the skewers or drying rack in the oven and leave the door slightly open to allow for air circulation.Let the Biltong dry for 3-4 hours, or until it's dry and firm but still slightly chewy.Remove the Biltong from the oven and let it cool to room temperature before serving.Store any leftover Biltong in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 2 weeks.

name: Maafe
cooking_method: In a large pot, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat.Add the chicken and cook until browned on all sides, about 5 minutes.Add the onions and garlic and cook until softened, about 3 minutes.Add the sweet potatoes, carrots, and red bell pepper and cook for 5 minutes.Add the diced tomatoes, tomato paste, and peanut butter, stirring to combine.Slowly pour in the chicken broth, stirring constantly to avoid lumps.Bring the mixture to a simmer and let it cook for 30-40 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the vegetables are tender and the sauce has thickened.Season with salt and pepper to taste.Serve the Maafe hot over cooked rice.

name: Jollof Spaghetti
cooking_method: Cook the spaghetti according to package directions until al dente. Drain and set aside.In a large pot or Dutch oven, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat.Add the onion and garlic and cook until softened, about 3 minutes.Add the tomato paste, diced tomatoes, and broth, stirring to combine.Add the bell peppers, carrot, thyme, curry powder, salt, and pepper, and stir to combine.Bring the mixture to a simmer and let it cook for 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the sauce has thickened and the vegetables are tender.Add the cooked spaghetti to the pot and toss to coat with the sauce.Let the spaghetti cook in the sauce for a few minutes until heated through.Serve the Jollof Spaghetti hot, garnished with chopped fresh parsley if desired.

name: Kitfo
cooking_method: In a large mixing bowl, combine the ground beef, niter kibbeh, and berbere.Using your hands, mix the ingredients together until well combined.Add salt to taste and mix again.Divide the mixture into four equal portions and shape each portion into a ball.Using a sharp knife, chop the beef balls into very small pieces.Heat a skillet over medium-high heat.Add the chopped beef to the skillet and cook for 1-2 minutes, stirring constantly, until the meat is lightly browned and no longer pink.Remove the skillet from the heat.Serve the Kitfo hot with injera on the side.

name: Braai
cooking_method: Prepare your fire or grill, making sure it is hot and the flames have died down.Brush the beef and lamb with the vegetable oil and season with salt and pepper.Place the beef and lamb on the grill and cook to your liking, turning occasionally, until browned and cooked through.Cook the boerewors on the grill until browned and cooked through, turning occasionally.Remove the meat and sausage from the grill and let it rest for a few minutes.Slice the meat into thin strips and arrange it on a platter.Serve the boerewors on a separate platter.Serve the braai hot, with lemon wedges on the side for squeezing over the meat.

name: Efo Riro
instructions: Heat the palm oil in a large pot over medium-high heat.Add the onion and sauté until softened.Add the meat and brown on all sides.Add the tomatoes and scotch bonnet peppers, and cook until the tomatoes have softened and the peppers are fragrant.Add the chicken or beef stock and bring to a simmer.Reduce the heat to medium and add the ground crayfish and smoked shrimp.Add the chopped spinach, a handful at a time, stirring until it wilts.Season with salt and pepper to taste.Cover the pot and let the soup simmer for 5-10 minutes.Serve hot with your choice of accompaniment, such as boiled yam or rice.

name: Piri Piri Chicken
cooking_method: In a large bowl, whisk together the Piri Piri sauce, olive oil, lemon juice, minced garlic, paprika, and salt.Add the chicken pieces to the bowl and toss to coat evenly with the marinade.Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 2 hours, or overnight for best results.Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C). Line a baking sheet with foil and place a wire rack on top.Remove the chicken from the marinade and place it on the wire rack, leaving some space between each piece.Bake the chicken in the oven for 40-45 minutes or until the internal temperature reaches 165°F (75°C) on an instant-read thermometer.Remove the chicken from the oven and let it rest for 5-10 minutes before serve
